summary: IBDV is a nonnveloped, icosahedral virus with a double-stranded RNA (dsRNA) genome consisting of two segments, segment A (3.2 kb) and segment B (2.8 kb) VP4 inhibits the expression of type I interferon (IFN) by binding to the glucocorticoid-induced leucine zipper (9). so far, three putative IBDV receptors on host cells have been identified. IgM in chicken B lymphocytes (11), integrin in mouse NIH 3T3 cells (12) and HSP90 (heat shock protein 90) in chicken fibroblasts (13). surface HSP90, a highly conserved molecular chaperone, can be present inside the cell. c-Src kinase is a multifunctional nonreceptor tyrosine kinase involved in regulating a diverse spectrum of biological activities. a number of viruses, including herpes simplex virus 8 (human herpesvirus 8 [HHV8]), japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) and bovine ephemeral fever virus (BEFV) stimulate c-Src phosphorylation to facilitate c-Src is phosphorylated at Y416 and Y527 (27) under basal conditions, c-Src is phosphorylated at Y527. intermolecular autophosphorylation of this site promotes kinase activity.
